revised_title: Neurotransmitter Receptor Interactions in Xenopus Oocytes
tldr: The article investigates the interactions between different neurotransmitter receptors in Xenopus oocytes. It demonstrates that serotonin, acetylcholine, and other neurotransmitters can activate a common effector system, suggesting that they may all link into a common receptor-channel coupling system. This system involves phosphoinositide metabolism and calcium liberation, leading to the opening of chloride channels in the oocyte membrane.
